(3) The AN/FSC-9 and AN/MSC-44 terminal installations did not, in general, include the TT&C antenna and system. The transmit and receive polarizations available at the AN/MSC-44 and Kingsport terminals were compatible with those of the Syncom sattellites. In contrast, the receive polarization of the AN/FSC-9 terminals was such that a S-dB polarization loss was suffered. By choosing circular polarization, however, it was no longer necessary to track variations in the linear polarization received from the satellite. The AN/FSC-9 and AN/MSC-44 terminals employed two axis (i. e., azimuth and elevation) tracking and control of the antenna. The Kingsport terminal was provided with a three-axis antenna, however, to ensure a capability for near zenith operation from the rolling and pitching ship. 8.5 EXPERIMENTS Experiments conducted on project Syncom are grouped in five major categories and defined in Table 8-7. Synchronous orbit injection was successfully completed on Syncoms I, Hl and IlI. In the latter case, a synchronous equatorial orbit was realized.
